key_responsibilities: overseeing a community outreach and federal casework portfolio
serving as the Office’s liaison to San Diego’s military and veteran communities
requirements: experience working with service members and/or military families
exceptional communication, organizational, and writing skills
a genuine desire to serve constituents
Bilingual and previous customer service skills are a plus

key_responsibilities: handling all aspects of front office operations
greeting and engaging with constituents
answering incoming telephone calls
handling tour and flag requests
supporting DC staff
managing the DC internship program
requirements: excellent oral and written communication skills
an eagerness to work in a collaborative office environment

key_responsibilities: Create weekly social media and communications plans
Create graphics for social media, newsletters, visual presentations and mail
Manage livestreaming, photography and videography at DC-based events
Oversee regular updates to the Congresswoman’s website
Monitor social media and media reports
Produce video content to share on social media and with local stakeholders
Other duties as assigned
requirements: proficient in graphic design and video production
proactive and a strategic thinker who works well with others
Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, Canva or other design programs required
Candidates with ties to Michigan are strongly encouraged to apply

key_responsibilities: drafting and advancing legislative proposals
preparing the Member for hearings and markups
meeting with stakeholders and constituents
providing vote recommendations
performing additional tasks as assigned
requirements: policy experience in one or more of those issue areas
the ability to operate with grace and humor in a fast-paced environment

key_responsibilities: manage the Member’s daily and long-term DC and MA schedule
manages two operations staff (one in DC and one in MA) and a Scheduling Assistant
organizes and tracks all events and invitations, travel arrangements, and Member preparation
Operationalizes the strategic priorities of the office
Works directly with DC and DO special assistants in coordinating all daily movements
Hires and manages Northeastern Co-op (Scheduling Assistant)
Provides scheduling update and read ahead in DC, district, and leads all scheduling meetings with senior staff and Seth
Manages task assignment and completion within the scheduling team, and responsible for schedule execution
Oversees calendar data information requests
requirements: 1+ years of experience in scheduling (Congressional scheduling experience preferred)
Superior written and verbal communication skills

key_responsibilities: Preparing and staffing the Congresswoman for committee hearings and markups
Advancing current and new legislative initiatives
Developing expertise in new issue areas as they arise
Representing the Congresswoman’s priorities with external stakeholders
Building and maintaining relationships with external and internal stakeholders
Carrying out additional duties as required
requirements: Passionate about public service and committed to progressive values
Excellent writing and time management skills
Ability to digest new content with a political and ideological lens
Poised, level-headed, flexible, collaborative, team oriented
Eager to learn, grow, and thrive in a dynamic and high-paced environment
State and/or district ties are a plus
Prior Hill experience is strongly preferred

office: U.S. House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, Republican Staff
key_responsibilities: conduct investigations into the Department of Veterans Affairs
conduct oversight of Subcommittee issue areas
develop investigative strategies and implementing investigative plans
review evidence and data to analyze, develop, and provide detailed written and oral reports of findings
interview witnesses and subjects
assist the Subcommittee Staff Director in advising the Full Committee leadership and Subcommittee leadership on legislative initiatives
draft hearing, markup, and floor statements
assist in determining Full Committee and Subcommittee hearing topics and prepare for hearings
meet with congressional staff and internal/external organizations on behalf of the Committee
perform other duties as assigned
requirements: At least three years of relevant work experience
Excellent writing, editing, and proofreading skills
Thoroughness and careful attention to detail
Demonstrate ability to exercise discretion and independent judgment
Knowledge of current issues and events
Ability to work long hours, under pressure
Domestic travel will be required (up to 40% of the time), with the possibility of international travel
Work independently or as part of an investigative team

key_responsibilities: develop and execute a coordinated plan to advance the Member’s communications goals
managing a highly active press shop
pitching and booking national and local media
working with the press secretary to develop and distribute press materials
writing and placing op-eds
managing the communications budget
overseeing the development and distribution of a large mass mail and digital advertising program
requirements: proven experience with pitching and booking national media
experience in defense and national security policy communications
Previous Hill and Communications Director experience is preferred

office: Subcommittee on Economic Opportunity, House Committee on Veterans’ Affairs, Republican Staff
key_responsibilities: Provides administrative, legislative, and research support to Subcommittee staff
Answering the telephone and responding to caller inquiries
Maintaining Subcommittee archive, activities report, and relevant publications
Assisting with Subcommittee hearings and full Committee hearings
Maintaining the Subcommittee’s outstanding deliverable requests made to the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA)
Participating in staff-level negotiations
Assist in drafting legislation for the Subcommittee
Assisting Subcommittee staff in organization of, and preparation for, hearings
Conducting meetings with VA, veteran service organizations or other scheduled parties
Briefing subcommittee Members’ staff
Drafting remarks for the Chairman and suggested questions for hearings
Preparing memorandums for the full and subcommittee Chairman
Research preparation of hearings by reviewing previous hearing transcripts, relevant statutes, and VA policy
Responsible for all other duties assigned
requirements: Work, internship, or other experience in a professional environment
Ability to work well under pressure

key_responsibilities: Develop and drive a multi-channel communications strategy
Assist with implementation of all HDP programs
Participate directly in HDP programs
Conduct periodic evaluations of HDP’s programs and activities
Advise HDP members on developments
Assist with managing HDP’s relationships with internal stakeholders and external stakeholders
requirements: substantial experience working in foreign policy or international development
Experience serving on congressional committees or commissions
familiarity with U.S.-funded democracy and governance programs
organizing executive-level training or international exchange programs is strongly preferred
A highly collaborative attitude and an ability to manage complex projects involving multiple stakeholders

key_responsibilities: managing the Congressman’s agriculture, appropriations, energy, and natural resources priorities
advising the Congressman on all legislative areas within their portfolio
monitoring floor debate
preparing vote recommendations
working closely with constituents and stakeholders on relevant district issues
requirements: minimum of 1 year in a Congressional office
